column5: Just a heads up the links posted last night for the UFC GSP fight are full of spam,malware, trojans etc.  I enjoyed watching the contest but now my computer is just being hammered with pop up ads,trojans etc. reset my homepages, deleted all my bookmarks etc.  My own fault should have know better!!!

lol download AVG from download.com and do a scan, that site also has tons of other programs for malware removal, also registry cleaners they help big time for computer speed and restoring it by getting rid of extra files on the computer that are null due to the parent program being deleted etc cleans up partial files and corrupted files
Doing a full scan with AVG now...
I would download this and run it http://www.simplysup.com/tremover/download.html
Thanks Terry will give it a spin.
Follow the instructions @ this link. It will get everything but will take some time.  http://forums.majorgeeks.com/showthread.php?t=35407
finally fixed thanks for the links!

Just a heads up the links posted last night for the UFC GSP fight are full of spam,malware, trojans etc.  I enjoyed watching the contest but now my computer is just being hammered with pop up ads,trojans etc. reset my homepages, deleted all my bookmarks etc.  My own fault should have know better!!!  My apologies if it was link i posted. Have been using that link for a few years now on recommendation on this site. Even use it for baseball and  hockey that isn't televised.as well.  I use Google Chrome and free AVAST!  spyware and have never had spyware....
I used that link and haven't had any problems...... did you click on any pop ups that came up during the fight?  What anti-virus are you using?  Burt
I use avast and it caught some viruses but something got through. No worries lesson learned.
Never had a problem with the link I posted. www.firstrowsports.eu
Probably something I did...perhaps I hit one of those pop up by mistake. But the fact that the sites are full of malware and Trojans is enough for me to stay away in the future.
Theres lots of programs out there to prevent such things. I never have an issue with on line programming.
You clicked on the jiggilies,didnt ya. Come on now.LOL

Why not get the real thing directly from the microsoft website...  It's called Microsoft Security Essentials..    It's the real deal, it's free and you'll never be asked to upgrade..  I wouldn't trust anything else!!!

Why not get the real thing directly from the microsoft website...  It's called Microsoft Security Essentials..    It's the real deal, it's free and you'll never be asked to upgrade..  I wouldn't trust anything else!!! Me either,plus a another spywhare app.Over three years,"touch wood" lol.
